channel.title: Old School Runescape has permanent F2P starting tomorrow (Feb 4th)
channel.description: It technically starts Feb 19th, but at this point the 2 week trial will run you into the update.

item.source: Old School Runescape has permanent F2P starting tomorrow (Feb 4th)

item.title: Old School Runescape has permanent F2P starting tomorrow (Feb 4th)
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:8, topic:549664”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=668551.msg4471198#msg4471198 date=1423025843]

That took them too long to realize that is how it should have been…

Except the deal was if people vote for F2P then they’ll be adding bonds.

So they’re adding bonds.

congratulations, you can now legally buy in game currency from jagex!
[/quote]Which has been around for what? A year or two now? Ever since they added bonds you could trade them for RS3 currency, and it was never against the rules to swap RS3 to OSRS gold.

I was hoping they wouldn’t taint 07 with this shit

How is it tainted… people buy gold regardless?

Instead of people RWTing it and potentially getting scammed, banned or whatever else there is now an alternative. Nothing wrong with it, imo.

And on top of the “iffy” benefits of using bonds to purchase gold it allows people that can’t afford or cannot pay for membership with real money, they can buy it with their in-game gold.

It just puts Jagex in a position where they’re ‘supporting’ the purchasing of an item that can be used for ingame currency. Atleast RWT is bannable and people get caught. It’s not exactly a microtransation, but it’s pretty damn close.[/quote]

Still a good semi solution to those rsgp buying sites that might scam people trying to buy some. So it is a good solution in my opinion

Read full topic

That took them too long to realize that is how it should have been…

Except the deal was if people vote for F2P then they’ll be adding bonds.

So they’re adding bonds.

congratulations, you can now legally buy in game currency from jagex!
[/quote]Which has been around for what? A year or two now? Ever since they added bonds you could trade them for RS3 currency, and it was never against the rules to swap RS3 to OSRS gold.

I was hoping they wouldn’t taint 07 with this shit

How is it tainted… people buy gold regardless?

Instead of people RWTing it and potentially getting scammed, banned or whatever else there is now an alternative. Nothing wrong with it, imo.

And on top of the “iffy” benefits of using bonds to purchase gold it allows people that can’t afford or cannot pay for membership with real money, they can buy it with their in-game gold.[/quote]
It just puts Jagex in a position where they’re ‘supporting’ the purchasing of an item that can be used for ingame currency. Atleast RWT is bannable and people get caught. It’s not exactly a microtransation, but it’s pretty damn close.
